# f5xc_forward_proxy_policy (Resource)

Shape of the Forward Proxy Policy specification

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_forward_proxy_policy" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the ForwardProxyPolicy. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the ForwardProxyPolicy will be created.

### Optional

- `allow_all` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--allow_all))
- `allow_list` (Block, Optional) Forward Proxy Rule. URL(s) and domains policy for forward proxy for a connection type (TLS or HTTP) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--allow_list))
- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `any_proxy` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--any_proxy))
- `deny_list` (Block, Optional) Forward Proxy Rule. URL(s) and domains policy for forward proxy for a connection type (TLS or HTTP) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--deny_list))
- `drp_http_connect` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--drp_http_connect))
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `network_connector` (Block, Optional) Object reference. This type establishes a direct reference from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred). Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--network_connector))
- `proxy_label_selector` (Block, Optional) Label Selector. This type can be used to establish a 'selector reference' from one object(called selector) to a set of other objects(called selectees) based on the value of expresssions. A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects. Label selector is immutable. expressions is a list of strings of label selection expression. Each string has ',' separated values which are 'AND' and all strings ar... (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--proxy_label_selector))
- `rule_list` (Block, Optional) Custom Rule List. List of custom rules (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--rule_list))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules`

Optional:

- `action` (String) Rule Action. The rule action determines the disposition of the input request API. If a policy matches a rule with an ALLOW action, the processing of the request proceeds forward. If it matches a rule with a DENY action, the processing of the request is terminated and an appropriate message/code returned to the originator. If it matches a rule with a NEXT_POLICY_SET action, evaluation of the current policy set terminates and evaluation of the next policy set in the chain begins. - DENY: DENY D...

Optional:

- `expressions` (List of String) Selector Expression. expressions contains the kubernetes style label expression for selections. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.k8s_label_selector: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.max_len: 4096 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.min_len: 1 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 1


<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--metadata"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.metadata`

Optional:

- `description` (String) Description. Human readable description. ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
- `name` (String) Name. This is the name of the message. The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1 ves.io.schema.rules.string.ves_object_name: true


<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--no_http_connect_port"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.no_http_connect_port`


<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--port_matcher"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.port_matcher`

Optional:

- `invert_matcher` (Boolean) Invert Port Matcher. Invert the match result.
- `ports` (List of String) Port Ranges. A list of strings, each of which is a single port value or a tuple of start and end port values separated by '-'. The start and end values are considered to be part of the range. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.port_range: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true


<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--prefix_list"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.prefix_list`

Optional:

- `prefixes` (List of String) IPv4 Prefix List. List of IPv4 prefixes that represent an endpoint ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.items.string.ipv4_prefix: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 128 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true


<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--tls_list"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.tls_list`

Optional:

- `tls_list` (Block List) TLS Domains. Domains in SNI for TLS connections ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--rule_list--rules--tls_list--tls_list))

<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--tls_list--tls_list"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.tls_list.tls_list`



<a id="nestedblock--rule_list--rules--url_category_list"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule_list.rules.url_category_list`

Optional:

- `url_categories` (List of String) URL Categories. List of url categories to be selected Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 128 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_forward_proxy_policy.example system/example
```
